post_text: We will miss you, Linda Wood! #MCSBlue Forever!
shared_text:
Tracey Lewis
June 10 at 11:13 PM ·

Thursday and Friday are exchange days at Madison Central. As all of your children come to grab their belongings and return their chromebooks, there is one person that will not be back next year to greet your child's smiling face. Linda Linda Lindsey Wood is officially retiring. Linda has been showering the children of MCS with her love and affection for 43 years. She has found special places in her heart for many a child, bringing in coats for some, daily hugs for others, a shoulder to cry on when needed, and always up for a personal walk with your child to their classroom. She's gone above and beyond to keep your children safe and loved. She's been an integral part of so many of our lives. Thursday and Friday there will be a special mailbox at the main entrance of the school for you and your children to drop off any cards or hand written notes or drawings or anything else you and/or your child would like to give to Linda for her to open up and cherish. It's the perfect time to share some love ❤️❤️❤️ in our crazy 2020 world!! Let's fill this mailbox with love for Linda!!!

Congratulations to #MCSBlue senior Jordan Mayne, who was named one of this year’s Section III Scholar-Athletes! She played soccer, basketball and softball, and she is in this year’s Top 10. She plans to attend Mohawk Valley Community College.

The Section III Scholar-Athlete Award Program annually recognizes seniors from member high schools with exemplary athletic and academic careers. These students serve as a model to others and demonstrate integrity, self-discipline and courage.

Instead of the traditional banquet, Section 3 Athletics held individual ceremonies for students outside its East Syracuse offices. Students and their families arrived at a specific time to receive their plaques and take photos in front of the official backdrop. Photos from the ceremony can be found on the Section III Twitter page: https://twitter.com/john_rathbun3.

CW6 will air a television special on the Scholar-Athlete Program on tonight at 6 p.m. It will also be streamed live on www.cnycentral.com.

Village of Madison
June 1 at 1:47 PM ·

Due to the pandemic, the Village of Madison is, unfortunately, unable to hold the Summer Recreation Program this year. While we are saddened that we will be unable to provide this to the community, it is also important that we follow appropriate government guidelines for the health and safety of the children, staff, and families. In lieu of this, we have made in-kind donations to our local food programs. This morning, we were pleased to provide our local food cupboard, located at the Madison Baptist Church on North Street, with many non-perishable food items and toiletry products. Hopefully, this will enable those in need to get the food and hygiene supplies they might need during this difficult time. If you or someone you know has need, or if you wish to donate, the Food Cupboard can be reached at (315)824-2993. Due to COVID-19, the Food Cupboard cannot take walk-ins currently, but can package the items needed for pickup.

With the recent closure of businesses across the state, many New Yorkers are at risk of losing their health insurance coverage as a result of COVID-19. Many are likely to be eligible for health coverage with financial assistance through NY State of Health due to their loss of coverage and income. NY State of Health opened a Special Enrollment Period last month for people who are uninsured. Look for a letter coming from the superintendent.

If you lost employer coverage, you must apply within 60 days of losing that coverage. Because of a loss of income, New Yorkers may also be eligible for Medicaid, the Essential Plan, Child Health Plus, or subsidized Qualified Health Plan coverage.

Visit www.nystateofhealth.ny.gov, call the Marketplace at 518-486-9102 or email NYSOH@health.ny.gov for more information.

We hope this message finds you healthy and well. As you may have heard, Governor Cuomo has closed schools through April 28th. In addition, the Board of Regents has cancelled Regents exams for the 2019-20 school year. We are expecting additional guidance from the New York State Education Department later this week and will send you a letter with updates once we have them.

Teachers have already prepared educational materials for students to cover this time period. This week's letter will provide additional information on delivery of these materials.

Also, please remember to visit our new, updated COVID-19 resource page, which you can find on the home page of our website. There, you'll find instructional materials, past communications, menus and information on childcare for essential workers.

Thank you so much for your support during this uncommon time.
